column1: Appendix table 17. Percent and standard errors of total budget from other sources, by type of problem-solving court, 2012a
Report title: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012 NCJ 249803
Data source: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, Ph.D., and Ramona R. Rantala, Tracey Kyckelhahn, Ph.D.
Appendix table 17. Percent and standard errors of total budget from other sources, by type of problem-solving court, 2012a
Note: Detail may not sum to total due to rounding. Percentages based on 77.9% item response rate.

a/Other sources of funding included Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, donations, civic organizations, board of mental health, Medicaid, United Way, bar association, tribal funding.
b/Handles alcohol- or drug-dependent offenders also charged with a driving offense.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012.
